intro: Psydrax dicoccos var. lanceolatus, commonly known as the African breadfruit or African star apple, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are typically consumed raw or cooked, and the seeds are used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts within its native range.
